Chris began to realize his passion for business development and started his ambitious career in the IT industry very early on. In 1997 while still going to school he co-founded Avalon Technology Group, a small solutions-based technology company. In 1999 he helped develop a web-based â€œthin-clientâ€ technology that paved the way for another new business venture, Hyperlinq Technologies.

Promoted to Director of I.T. in 2007, Chris oversaw the software development of Rentrakâ€™s new data processing, and measurement services for Internet, Mobile, and Linear TV. In 2010 after successful launches of both local station and network TV measurement services Chris was promoted again to VP of I.T. and currently oversees all the various I.T. aspects of developing, running, and launching Rentrakâ€™s new products.

Chris keeps himself busy studying Godâ€™s word, writing a blog, training for and running marathons, building new businesses, and spending time as a father of four: nine year-old Maggie, seven year-old Owen, 3 year-old, Sawyer, 1 year old Mercedes.
